snippet: Local governments are taking a hard line against a small number of bakers, florists, photographers and others who are declining to provide services for same-sex weddings.
abstract: Colorado court battle over refusal by bakery owner Jack Phillips to make cake for same-sex wedding is one of several disputes nationwide, spurred by local governments taking increasingly hard line on religious vendors refusing to serve gay couples; cases are largely being fought, and some say fueled, by legal advocacy organizations the American Civil Liberties Union, which supports same-sex marriage, and Alliance Defending Freedom, which opposes it.
lead_paragraph: Local governments are taking a hard line against a small number of bakers, florists, photographers and others who are declining to provide services for same-sex weddings.
